xxl.core.collections.containers

Class SynchronizedContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.collections.containers.SynchronizedContainer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Container

    public class SynchronizedContainer
extends Object
implements Container
    The class provides a synchronized decorator for a container that follows the Decorator Design Pattern (for further details see Structural Patterns, Decorator in Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software by Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, and John Vlissides).

    Note that this class redirects every method call to the underlying container. For this reason, the decorator container provides non of the default implementations of the container class. E.g., when decorating only the method insert(Object, boolean), a call to this method will be redirected to the underlying container.

    Also note: The iterators and cursors returned from methods of this class are not synchronized in any way. That might be a future extension of this class.

    See Also:
    Converter, Cursor, Function, Iterator, NoSuchElementException

    • Field Detail

      • container

        protected Container container
        A reference to the container to be decorated. This reference is used to perform method calls on the original container.

    • Method Detail

      • objectIdConverter

        public FixedSizeConverter objectIdConverter()
        Returns a converter for the ids generated by this container. A converter transforms an object to its byte representation and vice versa - also known as serialization in Java.
        Since the identifier may have an arbitrary type (which has to be known in the container), the container has to provide such a method when the data is not stored in main memory.
        Specified by:
        objectIdConverter in interface Container
        Returns:
        a converter for serializing the identifiers of the container.

      • getIdSize

        public int getIdSize()
        Returns the size of the ids generated by this container in bytes. Each id must have the same size.
        Specified by:
        getIdSize in interface Container
        Returns:
        the size in bytes of each id.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all elements from the Container. After a call of this method, size() will return 0.
        Note, that the implementation of this method relies on the remove operation of the iterator returned by the method ids().
        Specified by:
        clear in interface Container

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the Container and releases all sources. For external containers, this method closes the files immediately. MOREOVER, all iterators operating on the container can be in illegal states. Close can be called a second time without any impact.
        Note, that it would be desirable that the finalize-mechanism of Java would already offer the functionality of close. However, finalize does not release the sources immediately! Consequently, the corresponding file of a "closed" Container may be opened and some of the data is still not written back. This is a problem when for example the JVM stops running (because of a system error).
        Specified by:
        close in interface Container

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Object id)
        Returns true if there is an object stored within the container having the identifier id.
        Specified by:
        contains in interface Container
        Parameters:
        id - identifier of the object.
        Returns:
        true if the container contains an object for the specified identifier.

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Flushes all modified elements from the buffer into the container. After this call the buffer and the container are synchronized.
        Specified by:
        flush in interface Container

      • flush

        public void flush(Object id)
        Flushes the object with identifier id from the buffer into the container.
        Specified by:
        flush in interface Container
        Parameters:
        id - identifier of the object that should be written back.

      • get

        public Object get(Object id,
                  boolean unfix)
           throws NoSuchElementException
        Returns the object associated to the identifier id. An exception is thrown if there is not object stored with this id. If unfix is set to true, the object can be removed from the underlying buffer. Otherwise (!unfix), the object has to be kept in the buffer.
        Specified by:
        get in interface Container
        Parameters:
        id - identifier of the object.
        unfix - signals whether the object can be removed from the underlying buffer.
        Returns:
        the object associated to the specified identifier.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if the desired object is not found.

      • getAll

        public Iterator getAll(Iterator ids,
                       boolean unfix)
        Returns an iterator referring to the objects of the identifiers which are delivered by the iterator ids. The parameter unfix specifies whether the object can be removed from the buffer, see also the discussion of the method get().
        Specified by:
        getAll in interface Container
        Parameters:
        ids - an iterator of identifiers.
        unfix - signals whether the objects of the iterator can be removed from the underlying buffer.
        Returns:
        an iterator of objects.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if one of the desired objects is not found.

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • ids

        public Iterator ids()
        Returns an iterator that delivers all the identifiers of the container that are in use.
        Specified by:
        ids in interface Container
        Returns:
        an iterator of all identifiers used by this container.

      • insert

        public Object insert(Object object,
                     boolean unfix)
        Inserts a new object into the container and returns the unique identifier that the container has been associated to the object. The identifier can be reused again when the object is deleted from the buffer. If unfixed, the object can be removed from the buffer. Otherwise, it has to be kept in the buffer until an unfix() is called.
        After an insertion all the iterators operating on the container can be in an invalid state.
        This method also allows an insertion of a null object. In the application would really like to have such objects in the container, some methods have to be modified.
        Specified by:
        insert in interface Container
        Parameters:
        object - is the new object.
        unfix - signals whether the object can be removed from the underlying buffer.
        Returns:
        the identifier of the object.

      • insert

        public Object insert(Object object)
        Inserts a new object into the container and returns the unique identifier. This methods behaves like insert(object, true).
        Specified by:
        insert in interface Container
        Parameters:
        object - is the new object.
        Returns:
        the identifier of the object.

      • insertAll

        public Iterator insertAll(Iterator objects,
                          boolean unfix)
        Inserts all objects of a given Iterator into the container. It returns an iterator that contains the identifiers of the new objects.
        Note, that the order of the identifiers corresponds to the order of their objects. The meaning of unfix is the same as for the method insert.
        Specified by:
        insertAll in interface Container
        Parameters:
        objects - an iterator of objects that should be inserted.
        unfix - signals whether the object can be removed from the underlying buffer.
        Returns:
        an iterator containing the identifiers of the objects of the input iterator.

      • insertAll

        public Iterator insertAll(Iterator objects)
        Inserts all objects of a given Iterator into the container.
        Specified by:
        insertAll in interface Container
        Parameters:
        objects - an iterator of objects that should be inserted.
        Returns:
        an iterator containing the identifiers of the objects of the input iterator.

      • isUsed

        public boolean isUsed(Object id)
        Checks whether the id has been returned previously by a call to insert or reserve and hasn't been removed so far.
        Specified by:
        isUsed in interface Container
        Parameters:
        id - the id to be checked.
        Returns:
        true exactly if the id is still in use.

      • objects

        public Cursor objects()
        Returns a cursor containing all objects of the container. The order in which the cursor delivers the objects is not specified.
        Specified by:
        objects in interface Container
        Returns:
        a cursor containing all objects of the container.

      • remove

        public void remove(Object id)
            throws NoSuchElementException
        Removes the object with identifier id. An exception is thrown when an object with an identifier id is not in the container.
        After a call of remove() all the iterators (and cursors) can be in an invalid state.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface Container
        Parameters:
        id - an identifier of an object.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if an object with an identifier id is not in the container.

      • removeAll

        public void removeAll(Iterator ids)
        Removes the objects with the identifiers given by the iterator ids.
        The default implementation calls remove(id) for each identifier of ids.
        Specified by:
        removeAll in interface Container
        Parameters:
        ids - an iterator containing identifiers of objects.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if an object with an identifier of ids is not in the container.

      • reserve

        public Object reserve(Function getObject)
        Reserves an id for subsequent use. The container may or may not need an object to be able to reserve an id, depending on the implementation. If so, it will call the parameterless function provided by the parameter getObject.
        Specified by:
        reserve in interface Container
        Parameters:
        getObject - A parameterless function providing the object for that an id should be reserved.
        Returns:
        the reserved id.

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of elements of the container.
        Specified by:
        size in interface Container
        Returns:
        the number of elements.

      • unfix

        public void unfix(Object id)
           throws NoSuchElementException
        Unfixes the Object with identifier id. This method throws an exception when no element with an identifier id is in the container. After one call of unfix() the buffer is allowed to remove the object (although the objects have been fixed more than once).
        The default implementation only checks whether an object with identifier id is in the buffer.
        Specified by:
        unfix in interface Container
        Parameters:
        id - identifier of an object that should be unfixed in the buffer.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if no element with an identifier id is in the container.

      • unfixAll

        public void unfixAll(Iterator ids)
        Unfixes the objects with identifiers given by iterator ids. All the objects are unfixed which belong to one of the identifiers of ids.
        The default implementation calls the method unfix() for each identifier of ids.
        Specified by:
        unfixAll in interface Container
        Parameters:
        ids - an iterator of identifiers.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if the identifier id isn't used by the container.

      • update

        public void update(Object id,
                   Object object,
                   boolean unfix)
            throws NoSuchElementException
        Overwrites an existing (id,*)-element by (id, object). This method throws an exception if an object with an identifier id does not exist in the container.
        Specified by:
        update in interface Container
        Parameters:
        id - identifier of the element.
        object - the new object that should be associated to id.
        unfix - signals whether the object can be removed from the underlying buffer.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if an object with an identifier id does not exist in the container.

      • update

        public void update(Object id,
                   Object object)
        Overwrites an existing (id,*)-element by (id, object). This method throws an exception if an object with an identifier id does not exist in the container. The default implementation only consists of a call of update(id, object, true).
        Specified by:
        update in interface Container
        Parameters:
        id - identifier of the element.
        object - the new object that should be associated to id.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if an object with an identifier id does not exist in the container.

      • updateAll

        public void updateAll(Iterator ids,
                      Function function,
                      boolean unfix)
        Overwrites the elements of a container whose identifiers are given by iterator ids. For each identifier of ids, this method calls update(id, function.invoke(id)).
        Specified by:
        updateAll in interface Container
        Parameters:
        ids - an iterator of identifiers.
        function - a function that computes the object which should be associated to an identifier.
        unfix - signals whether the object can be removed from the underlying buffer.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if an object with an identifier of ids does not exist in the container.

      • updateAll

        public void updateAll(Iterator ids,
                      Function function)
        Overwrites the elements of a container whose identifiers are given by iterator ids.
        Specified by:
        updateAll in interface Container
        Parameters:
        ids - an iterator of identifiers.
        function - a function that computes the object which should be associated to an identifier.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if an object with an identifier of ids does not exist in the container.

      • updateAll

        public void updateAll(Iterator ids,
                      Iterator objects,
                      boolean unfix)
        Overwrites the elements of a container whose identifiers are given by iterator ids. The objects that have to be associated to the elements are also given as an iterator.
        Specified by:
        updateAll in interface Container
        Parameters:
        ids - an iterator of identifiers
        objects - an iterator of objects
        unfix - signals whether the object can be removed from the underlying buffer.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if an object with an identifier of ids does not exist in the container.

        updateAll in interface Container
        Parameters:
        ids - an iterator of identifiers
        objects - an iterator of objects
